OOC: I'll speed things up a little, sorry if Jeff or Lurker feel bad
about it. I'll just state the whole thing and assume your chars are
inside.

Bic:

Krhinos composed a confidential code on the lift panel that would lead
them to the docking bay of the massive corporate station. All the
while, he briefed his two crewmembers.

Krhinos: We're going to prehistoric Earth at around the era of the
Beast Wars. The precise period is supposed to be free of any conflict,
but you're better safe than sorry. Anyhow, we mine for anything we
can, processing it and sending it back. I've even received
authorization to use our special "dynamite fairies"... Quite effective
a drilling method, I might say. We tested them on Asteroid Tykus...
which happens not to exist anymore. If I'm right, there's likely to be
tons of energon there. Whether it's stable or not, I don't know, but
it's worth billions as we speak! So, gentlemen, embark the station and
prepare it. We depart as soon as we're done.

With that, the doors opened and revealed a huge mobile station that
waited only to go across space...

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "LurkerAbyss" <1641coburn@r...> wrote:
> Dracon slips into the elevator, staying silent and simply listening
in on the conversation.
>   ----- Original Message ----- 
>   From: Nic 
>   To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
>   Sent: Friday, June 06, 2003 11:02 PM
>   Subject: Re: The new Contract
> 
> 
>   Krhinos entered an elevator and signaled his two other companions to
>   follow him.
> 
>   Krhinos: No matter. They must all have been too drunk to notice
>   anyways. The point is, though, that we are going on a mission and we
>   bring in a full mining and processing station with us. Outpost on
>   planet, space relay. In short, the full monty! This is one heck of a
>   contract!
> 
>   --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "Jeff" <x_rauq_x@y...> wrote:
>   > --Rukus--
>   > 
>   > "Lead on. Keep an eye out for tails." Rukus eyes the crowd as he 
>   > speaks. No bots attracted notice under his careful scrutiny, but 
>   > that didn't mean anything. "We weren't being descrete, so unwelcome 
>   > eyes may have wavered our way."
>   > 
>   > 
>   > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "LurkerAbyss" <1641coburn@r...>
wrote:
>   > > Dracon made no gestures and remained blank in the face, almost to 
>   > the point of appearing to be sinister.
>   > > 
>   > > "If it's important...then let's go," he said, agreeing with 
>   > Krhinos, "we should discuss this ordeal furthermore amongst 
>   > ourselves..."
>   > >   ----- Original Message ----- 
>   > >   From: Nic 
>   > >   To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
>   > >   Sent: Thursday, June 05, 2003 10:26 PM
>   > >   Subject: Re: The new Contract
>   > > 
>   > > 
>   > >   Krhinos watched the lithe bot come close and sneaking past the 
>   > crowd.
>   > > 
>   > >   Krhinos: Rukus, right? Good then. I guess this is the whole of 
>   > the
>   > >   crew. I'd tell you more about this mission, but not in here.
Too 
>   > many
>   > >   ears and I don't trust about all of them. Suffice it to say,
your
>   > >   paycheck is sitting calmly on the mobile station and you are 
>   > eligible
>   > >   to 3.75% of the profits we make on this operation. The number 
>   > might
>   > >   seem low, but wait for the real thing! Now come along and let's 
>   > go
>   > >   somewhere more private.
>   > > 
>   > >   Ironically, he was saying this precise sentence in the precise 
>   > place
>   > >   and to the precise poeple in which circumstances it seemed 
>   > weird. In
>   > >   fact, one of the pleasure bots was saying the same thing to a 
>   > drunken
>   > >   miner who was nearly passed out on the floor. Lucky for her,
the 
>   > guy
>   > >   had already paid her, twice rather than once, drunk as he was.
>   > >
